description: Apparently a 1st CE roundhouse interpreted as a shrine and associated with a villa, later replaced by a 3rd CE masonry shrine. Apparently 5th CE usage of the shrine is apparent based on pottery
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Preston Court Farm, Beddingham (East Sussex).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Rudling, David R. “The Development of Roman Villas in Sussex.” Sussex Archaeological Collections 136 (1998): 4165. https://doi.org/10.5284/1085037.

Waldron, Tony, G M Taylor, and David R Rudling. “Sexing of Romano-British Baby Burials from the Beddingham and Bignor Villas .” Sussex Archaeological Collections 137 (2002): 7179. https://doi.org/10.5284/1085893.
